name: Overtheory
description: Just for fun.

name: Big Rigging
Tagged Grid 4.0
description:
I always prefer playing runner side and i always have dificulty designing corp decks. This is my attempt to make a NBN tag deck that has also some fast advance capability.

Made some changes after wswan suggestions: Included Elizabeth Mills to deal with Muckraker's bad pub and i've also modified my ice's roster to include some more barriers.

After crack's comments i decided to drop net police and go with sea source, i've also rearrenged my ice and included 1 biotic labour to help fast advance.

Suggestions appreciated :)

name: Blood Money 2.0
description: dropped my biotic labour, it was senseless here and added Mushin no Shin which i believe makes much more sense, if i'm going for the super server.

name: Anatomy of Anarch: Variation
description:
I liked the AoA deck that has been floating around, but I felt it collapsed to any decent HB player (I have yet to win vs them, and have hardly scored any points). Asset economy and lots of strong ICE that has lots of subs is terrible to fight against with crypsis, and unless the turn 1 draw consisted of Imps and Siphons that you could land then the game rapidly dissolved as every server was protected by 3 ICE. Eli as an example is 3 to rez and either 4 or 6 for the basic deck to break. Most HB ICE is just too expensive for anarch economy to get through even semi-regularly.

Thus I reworked the deck. The biggest changes have been dropping Siphons and the DLR Josh B combo. At least 1 Siphon had to go to make room for the desperately needed e3s (which also work with knight against non HB). I decided that 1 Siphon with 2 planned assaults freed up influence but meant that the ability to get to Siphon early was not actually compromised. 3 cards in the deck still lead to siphon, although yes once you have it there is technically slightly less chance of repeating it given that the other planned assault can now no longer lead to siphon. I know this makes the deck slightly weaker vs other opponents, but I hope it gives it overall a little more consistency and variation now that stimhack and vamp are floating around.

Having the planned assaults also meant needing a few more run events, so 1 stimhack and 1 vamp were added, meaning that planned assault can get you what you need at the time. The continuing SoTs and Déjà Vus mean you can still potentially land 7 siphons, which is enough in a single game. I know that this change has made the deck slightly weaker vs other opponents, but I consider it necessary to make the deck viable against HB.

I took out the DLR Josh B combo because I felt it was 5 cards spent on a 'win harder' scenario. When ahead throwing the combo down does horrible things to the corp, but when behind it doesn't really help in any way. also I found I was probably only using it once a game on average before ti was trashed, and this just doesn't seem worth 5 card slots.

Given the liberated accounts and tag me nature of the deck I am assuming they will be used in an 'install, take 12' type scenario.

Any thoughts are welcome!

name: Programme Hell: Upstalk Edition
description:
It's back, and this time . . . it's personal.

Testimonials:

"I didn't think this deck was very good when I first saw it, but then I said to myself: "Self, I think we should try this deck out." and ever since then: I've won all of my netrunner games, I've grown a fuller, thicker head of hair, and I am in a constant state of arousal. Thanks Programme Hell!" - chill84

"One day I was looking for a new deck to play, and I happened to stumble across this build of Programme Hell. So I sleeved it up and took it to my local playgroup night. Everyone was amazed at how the deck ran. Next week when I came back, everyone had a copy sleeved up! Nobody won a corp game that night. It was like a glorious Professor orgy (the good kind, like with supermodels and blackjack). And to boot, ever since first piloting the deck, I've lost 20 lbs, had all of my debts forgiven, and my girlfriend has started commenting how much sexier I've become. Programme Hell is the best thing to ever happen to me." - Ravengm

"This deck is so baws I had "Programme Hell" tattooed on my chin and I have yet to fail at anything I've done since.

Be warned, you're opponents will feed their cards into a wood chipper after playing you." - voltorocks

"I have created a monster." - Destragon

name: Chaos Turbo Rig II
NEH: These are bad times...
description: Tag punishment, NBN style ;)

name: "Kit" Ice Destruction Rush
description: I've had a lot of success locally, generally play errors rather than shortages in tools are what get me. The game plan is to apply constant pressure with Yog runs and Parasite recursion. Most of the time they can't keep up and start to let you through somewhere. Large ice towers can be a problem when you falter early on, but if you keep early pressure you can keep their econ at a level where Wotan, Curtain Wall, Heimdall and the rest are not readily available. I've never had to deal with anything bigger than a Viktor 2.0 or an Ichi 1.0 so if they manage to get anything bigger I'm still not sure if I can deal.

name: Nothing But Courage
description:
You wanted it, you got it.

229 cards. 92 agenda points. No end the run subroutines. No run-ending assets or upgrades. It's a stack the better part of a foot high of sex and winning.

Like, favorite, subscribe, and see what Nothing But Courage can do for you.

name: Ice Hell: Jinteki Edition
description:
Is Programme Hell ruining your meta? Why not try Ice Hell, the new development from BS industries. We also sell industrial card shufflers.

  • 120 ice - the maximum amount possible
  • Guaranteed to intimidate your opponent
  • Superior deck size
  • New high-variance technology makes you irresistable to people you find attractive

Testimonials always welcome.

Testimonials:

"After making the deck release legal I played a Noise deck the other day on OCTGN. Half way through the game he said "Is your deck really 216 cards big? Is that even legal?!", I said "Yes, sir, 89 Agenda points," then he quit the game.

Immediately after that game I got a call from the Lord General of Canada, informing me that he was so impressed with my Netrunner deck I was to be commissioned into our cybermilitary defense ranks. I said yes and never looked back.

Thanks Ice Hell: Jinteki Edition." - Gilbod

"I sat down to play this deck against the local "that guy." The beautiful gamer girl behind the counter rolled her eyes at his "m'lady" as he came to sit across from me. As I sat the deck down on the table, he laughed and called over to her, "Watch me beat this scrub."

She comes over and eyes him and the deck with a look that could only be described as pure fury, clearly she had had enough. "LOOK 'THAT GUY', IF YOU'RE DICK IS HALF AS BIG AS THIS GUYS DECK, I'LL TAKE YOU IN THE BATHROOM RIGHT NOW." I push myself back from the table in horror at this proposition, but 'that guy' looks at her, then the deck that he had until moments ago been laughing at, bursts into tears, and runs from the shop. She grabs my hand and drags me into the bathroom for the best sex of my life.

Thanks Ice Hell: Jinteki Edition!" - Flashfires

"Someone said beware of my Atman deck and I said "OH YEAH ?" and he said "YES YEAH !" and I won.

Thanks Ice Hell: Jinteki Edition!" - Syntax

"I shredded this deck and put it in a blender with some coffee and horse blood. Best enema of my life." - max.kuipers

name: Signal Versus Noise
description:
Shaper player trying to build a Noise deck. The plan is to Imp everything I can, pressure whichever central (besides archives) is weakest at the moment, use scavenge and clone chip to get plenty of Imp counters/virus installs, and clean out archives.

All feedback is super appreciated.

name: Season 1 Store Tournament 1st Place Corp 6/14/2014
description: Went undefeated with this deck and surprisingly enough I didn't trigger a Midseasons the entire day. With an abundance of runners going tag me with account siphon or with DLR builds, using Psychographics to score out agendas helped out tremendously (a few game point agendas were scored this way straight from the deck with Fast Track!). Snare provides scoring windows if it's hit late in their turn by forcing them to draw back up, clear the tag, and often tips the runner off to a potential scorch strategy which sends them digging for a Plascrete. I'll gladly push out agendas while they waste they're time protecting against something I never had in the first place!

name: 2014 Seattle Regional. 1st Place. 78 People. Uncle's Games.
description:
I've always been a Gabe guy...this was my first time with Andromeda.

Nothing TOO surprising here.

Data Dealer was a meta call, since I've been Shi-Kyu'd a TON.....I didn't use it the entire day. Infiltrations can also be swapped out for whatever you prefer, but I like the versatility they provide. Gordian Blade instead of Yog.0 to deal with all the bigger code gates I run into if I get locked out, & for the upcoming Lotus Field that will be EVERYWHERE. Kati Jones puts in work for you. Corp decks are much more expensive to run & you need to keep banking on Ms. Jones to keep you going.

Corps Played that day: HB:Next, HB:ETF, Jinteki:RP, NBN:MN, NBN:TWiY, Jinteki:Tennin, Jinteki:RP, NBN:MN

CHEERS!

name: 2014 Seattle Regional. 1st Place. 78 People. Uncle's Games
description:
We should call this Red Jackets. Or Red Sweater. Or Red Poncho. Everyone seems to throw names onto Corp decks nowadays.

Inspired by decks I've seen Mediohxcore & Genestealers play, this is a taxing Jinteki Deck. Going away from the normal kill strategy, the success of this deck is based on your assets & expensive centrals. I've been torn between Fetal AI or Future Perfect as the last agenda. Sometimes you get to 4 & you just want that 3 pointer to close it out, but I also don't like having extra points in my decks. Inazuma was kind of meh & ICHI 2.0 was just OK. Another Tollbooth & a Quandary might be better.

You play this deck like HB rather than like Jinteki. Be ready for a longer grind of a game. Try to get out your econ assets out as fast as possible, protecting them or not is a call on who you're playing. It is good to lightly protect Sundews. Ideally, I liked to have some type of ETR ICE as the innermost ICE protecting centrals with something they'll HAVE to pay for as the outermost. You don't want them just running into your server for free, only to jack out & run the remotes. A Remote with 2 or 3 stacked ELIs & a Caprice hiding behind it can be amazing. 12 credits with Corroder & THEN a PSI game to get through?! FML. You'll feel poor at first but will eventually stabilize & the money should start pouring in. Scoring a NISEI MKII should be your first priority. This is like an AstroTrain but for Jinteki.

Runners Played that day: Andromeda, Kate, Iain, Andromeda, Reina, Reina, Andromeda, Andromeda

CHEERS!
